description: This degree program is offered by the Department of Computer Science and the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering. In addition to the requirements below, students must consult the Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science program requirements.
programRequirementsRtf:
Program requirements

This program is accredited by the Accreditation Board of Engineers Canada. Accreditation ensures that graduates of the program satisfy the academic requirements for licensure as a professional engineer by Engineers and Geoscientists BC.

Many courses are offered only one time per year. Refer to the Faculty website for course scheduling information. Consult with a program adviser for schedule planning advice.

Deviation from the standard program schedule requires submission of a Program Planning Worksheet and approval by the BSEng Program before commencement of term. See your program adviser for more information.

Alternate first year schedules for spreading the first year course load over three terms may be available. See the section titled "First year schedule" in Faculty of Engineering: Requirements or the BSEng program website.

Note

  • Students may select either CSC 421 or ECE 470, but not both.
  • Students may select either CSC 429 or ECE 406, but not both.
  • Other courses that may qualify as technical electives are topic courses, directed studies, technical projects and other courses offered by the Faculty of Engineering. Students interested in such courses must consult a program adviser and seek pre-approval from the BSEng Program.
programRequirements:
Year 1

  • Complete all of the following
    • Complete all of:
      • CSC111 - Fundamentals of Programming with Engineering Applications (1.5)
      • CSC115 - Fundamentals of Programming II (1.5)
      • ENGR110 - Design and Communication I (2.5)
      • ENGR120 - Design and Communication II (2.5)
      • ENGR130 - Introduction to Professional Practice (0.5)
      • MATH101 - Calculus II (1.5)
      • MATH110 - Matrix Algebra for Engineers (1.5)
      • PHYS110 - Introductory Physics I (1.5)
    • Complete 1 of:
      • MATH100 - Calculus I (1.5)
      • MATH109 - Introduction to Calculus (1.5)
    • Complete 1 of:
      • CHEM101 - Fundamentals of Chemistry from Atoms to Materials (1.5)
      • CHEM150 - Engineering Chemistry (1.5)
    • Complete 1.5 units of:
      Natural Science Electives (see note below)

Year 2

  • Complete all of the following
    • Complete 1 of:
      • CSC230 - Introduction to Computer Architecture (1.5)
      • ECE255 - Introduction to Computer Architecture (1.5)
    • Complete all of:
      • CSC225 - Algorithms and Data Structures I (1.5)
      • ECE260 - Continuous-Time Signals and Systems (1.5)
      • ECE310 - Digital Signal Processing I (1.5)
      • ECON180 - Introduction to Economics and Financial Project Evaluation (1.5)
      • MATH122 - Logic and Foundations (1.5)
      • SENG265 - Software Development Methods (1.5)
      • SENG275 - Software Testing (1.5)
      • SENG310 - Human Computer Interaction (1.5)
      • STAT260 - Introduction to Probability and Statistics I (1.5)
    • Complete 3.0 units of:
      Complementary Studies Electives (see note below)

Year 3

  • Complete all of the following
    • Complete 1 of:
      • CSC355 - Digital Logic and Computer Organization (1.5)
      • ECE355 - Microprocessor-Based Systems (1.5)
    • Complete 1 of:
      • CSC361 - Computer Communications and Networks (1.5)
      • ECE363 - Communication Networks (1.5)
    • Complete all of:
      • CSC226 - Algorithms and Data Structures II (1.5)
      • CSC320 - Foundations of Computer Science (1.5)
      • CSC360 - Operating Systems (1.5)
      • CSC370 - Database Systems (1.5)
      • ECE360 - Control Theory and Systems I (1.5)
      • SENG321 - Requirements Engineering (1.5)
      • SENG350 - Software Architecture and Design (1.5)
      • SENG360 - Security Engineering (1.5)
      • SENG371 - Software Evolution (1.5)
    • Complete 1.5 units of:
      Natural Science Electives (see note below)

Year 4

  • Complete all of the following
    • Complete 1 of:
      • CSC460 - Design and Analysis of Real-time Systems (1.5)
      • ECE455 - Real Time Computer Systems Design Project (1.5)
    • Complete all of:
      • SENG401 - Social and Professional Issues (1.5)
      • SENG426 - Software Quality Engineering (1.5)
      • SENG440 - Embedded Systems (1.5)
      • SENG499 - Design Project II (3)
    • Complete 7.5 units of:
      Technical Electives (see list below)
    • Complete 1.5 units of:
      Natural Science Electives (see note below)
title: Software Engineering
programNotes:
Program notes

  • Some technical electives have been organized into specializations: see the BSEng Program website for more information.

Complementary Studies Elective Courses

See Complementary Studies Elective Courses for list of approved courses.

Natural Science Elective Courses

See Natural Science Elective Courses for list of approved courses.
coOpRequirements:
Co-op requirements

Co-operative Education is mandatory in the BSEng degree program. Please refer to the Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science Co-operative Education Requirements.
admissionRequirementsRtf:
Admission requirements

For information on admission requirements, refer to the Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science.
additionalProgramRequirementsRtf:
In addition, students must complete four Co-op work terms (ENGR 001, 002, 003, 004), as per the Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science Academic and Work/Other Term Schedule.

Notes

  • When the following pairs of courses are offered in the same term, only one of them may be open to BSEng students:
    • ECE 255 and CSC 230
    • ECE 355 and CSC 355
    • ECE 363 and CSC 361
    • ECE 455 and CSC 460
  • Complementary studies electives are courses dealing with central issues in the humanities or social sciences, as required by CEAB guidelines for complementary studies, and as approved by the Faculty of Engineering. Students may choose a course from a pre-approved list, see Complementary Studies Elective Courses or seek permission from the Engineering Undergraduate Office (EUO).
  • Natural science electives are required by CEAB guidelines and as approved by the Faculty of Engineering. Students may choose a course from a pre-approved list, see Natural Science Elective Courses or seek permission from the Engineering Undergraduate Office (EUO).

BSEng 4th year technical electives

Students in the BSEng Program must complete five technical electives (7.5 units) from the list below.

Students who transferred from other programs or post-secondary institutions must choose their electives in consultation with a program adviser. Their choice of electives requires pre-approval by the BSEng Program.

Not all technical elective courses are offered every year. Refer to the CSC and ECE Department websites for course scheduling information. Consult with a program adviser for schedule planning advice.
